context: Miami's heavy-rail rapid transit system, <a0_0><b5_0>Metrorail<b5_0/><a0_0/>, is an elevated system comprising two lines and <a2_0><b7_0>23<b7_0/><a2_0/> stations on a <a1_0><b6_0>24.4<b6_0/><a1_0/>-mile (39.3 km)-long line. Metrorail connects the urban western suburbs of Hialeah, Medley, and inner-city Miami with suburban The Roads, Coconut Grove, Coral Gables, South Miami and urban Kendall via the central business districts of Miami International Airport, the Civic Center, and Downtown. A <a4_0><b9_0>free<b9_0/><a4_0/>, elevated people mover, Metromover, operates 21 stations on <a3_0><b8_0>three<b8_0/><a3_0/> different lines in greater Downtown Miami, with a station at roughly every two blocks of Downtown and Brickell. Several expansion projects are being funded by a transit development sales tax surcharge throughout Miami-Dade County.
